title: Identifying the Changing Quantities
text: The first step is to identity the changing quantities. From the problem, we can see that the year town populations change, so our variables are "time" and "population."
speech: The first step is to identity the changing quantities. From the problem, we can see that the year town populations change, so our variables are "time" and "population."
pacedSpeech: The first step is to identity the changing quantities. From the problem, we can see that the year town populations change, so our variables are "time" and "population."

title: Defining Input and Output
text: The next step is to define input and output. Our input is "time," and our output is "population." To make the input nicer, instead of defining time with the year number, we will let time, represented by the variable $$t$$, be equal to the number of years after $$2004$$. Thus, in $$2004$$, $$t$$ $$=$$ $$0$$. Our output is P(t), which represents population as a function of time.

Thus, in  2004 ,  t   is equal to   0 . Our output is P(t), which represents population as a function of time.

title: Determining the Rate of Change
text: We need to determine the rate of change-- that is, the change in output over the change in input. This is equivalent to the slope of the linear model, which is constant by the definition of linearity (a line.)
speech: We need to determine the rate of change-- that is, the change in output over the change in input. This is equivalent to the slope of the linear model, which is constant by the definition of linearity (a line.)

title: Solving for the Rate of Change
text: In $$2004$$, $$t$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ and P(t) $$=$$ $$6200$$. We can represent this with the coordinate point $$(0,6200)$$. In $$2009$$, $$t$$ $$=$$ $$5$$ (since $$2009-2004=5)$$ and P(t) $$=$$ $$8100$$, giving us the point $$(5,8100)$$. The slope, $$m$$, is calculated as the change in $$y$$ over the change in $$x$$.

Identifying the Y Intercept of the Line
text: We have determined that the slope is $$380$$ $$\frac{people}{year}$$ (since we dividing the change in $$y$$, which was in units of people, by the change in $$x$$, which was in units of years.) For the equation of the line, we need to know the y-intercept, which occurs when $$t$$ $$=$$ $$0$$.

title: Writing the Equation of the Line
text: The slope is $$380$$ and the $$y$$ intercept is $$6200$$, so we know the line $$y$$ $$=$$ mx + $$b$$, with $$y$$ being P(t), $$x$$ being $$t$$, $$m$$ being slope, and $$b$$ being the y-intercept, is $$P(t)=380t+6200$$.
